intro: Hartogia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower hartogia, is a rare and unique plant species native to the arid regions of South Africa. It is characterized by its small, solitary flower that typically blooms in late summer. The plant has a compact growth habit with a short, thick stem and waxy, gray-green leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, with five petals that are slightly curled at the edges. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Hartogia uniflora is considered a threatened species.
